choices.text: 63 days
72 days
84 days
90 days

questions.text: The Anti-progesterone compound RU-486 is effective for inducing abortion if the duration of pregnancy is?
questions.solution:
Ans. A. 63 days

Explanation:

  • RU-486 is Mifepristone and along with Misoprostol, it is used for medical methods of abortion.
  • A combi pack of mifepristone and misoprostol (one tablet of mifepristone 200mg and four tablets of misoprostol 200mcg each) has been approved by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organization, Directorate General of Health Services, for the medical termination of pregnancy up to n ee9ks (63 days) LMP in December 2008
  • However; CAC Training & Service Delivery Guidelines, 2016 by MoHFW, GoI recommends its use up to 49 days (7 weeks) in public sector sites, in line with the MTP Rules 2003.
  • A proposed amendment to the MTP Act, 1971, to increase the gestation limit for MMA to 9 weeks in public sector sites is under process. Till the proposal is approved, MMA in public health facility would be allowed only up to 7 weeks.
  • So if the question asks approved for use in public health facility, the answer will be 49 days, but it can be given till 9 weeks of pregnancy

Other Options: 

  • Option B, C and D all have duration > 63 days. Betwen 9 - 12 weeks, suction evacuation is preferred. After 12 weeks, a medical abortion is again preferred (i.e. different regimes of mifepristone f/b misoprostol have been described). 

Educational Objective: 

  • A combi pack of mifepristone and misoprostol (one tablet of mifepristone 200mg and four tablets of misoprostol 200mcg each) has been approved by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organization, Directorate General of Health Services, for the medical termination of pregnancy up to n ee9ks (63 days) LMP in December 2008
  • However; CAC Training & Service Delivery Guidelines, 2016 by MoHFW, GoI recommends its use up to 49 days (7 weeks) in public sector sites, in line with the MTP Rules 2003.

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

choices.text: Cervical insufficiency
Endometriosis
Intra-uterine synechiae
Subfertility

questions.text: A 34y G3P2L2 at 9 weeks opts for a surgical evacuation of the uterus following an unwanted pregnancy. Which is NOT a long term complication of dilatation and evacuation?
questions.solution:
Ans. B. Endometriosis

 

Explanation:

 

Long term sequelae of suction evacuation/ dilatation and evacuation are:

 

  1. Pelvic inflammation

  2. Subfertility

  3. Cervical insufficiency

  4. Preterm labor

  5. Ectopic pregnancy

  6. Intra uterine synechiae

 

Endometriosis is NOT a complication of Dilatation and Evacuation

 

Educational Objective: 

 

Long term sequelae of suction evacuation/ dilatation and evacuation are:

 

  1. Pelvic inflammation

  2. Subfertility

  3. Cervical insufficiency

  4. Preterm labor

  5. Ectopic pregnancy

  6. Intra uterine synechiae

 

Ref: page no 361, Williamâ€™s Obstetrics 25th edition

choices.text: 20 weeks
24 weeks
28 weeks
No upper limit

questions.text: As per the 2021 amendment of the MTP act, the upper limit of gestational age for terminating a fetus with substantial anomalies is:
questions.solution:
Ans: D. No upper limit

 

Explanation:

Very Important 

As per the 2021 MTP amendment: act, a few important changes which you have to know are that the upper limit of gestational age has been increased  as per the following: 

  •  Till 20 weeks for original indications (maternal indication, fetal indication, failure of contraception and rape); opinion of 1 RMP required
  • Till 24 weeks for select indications like fetal maformation, rape, humanitarian grounds and maternal diability; opinion of 2 RMPS required
  • After 24 weeks: Only for substantial fetal malformations (No upper limit but this has to be allowed by a medical board)

Educational Objective: 

 

As per the 2021 MTP amendment: act, a few important changes which you have to know are that the upper limit of gestational age has been increased  as per the following: 

  •  Till 20 weeks for original indications (maternal indication, fetal indication, failure of contraception and rape); opinion of 1 RMP required
  • Till 24 weeks for select indications like fetal maformation, rape, humanitarian grounds and maternal diability; opinion of 2 RMPS required
  • After 24 weeks: Only for substantial fetal malformations (No upper limit but this has to be allowed by a medical board)

Ref: http://164.100.47.4/BillsTexts/LSBillTexts/Asintroduced/55_2020_LS_Eng.pdf

choices.text: Uterine sound
Uterine curette
Hegar dilator
Laminaria tent

questions.text: An intern is assisting the OBGYN resident for a dilatation and evacuation for a surgical abortion. The resident asks him what this instrument is. Identify the instrument:
questions.solution:
Ans: C. Hegar dilator

Explanation

  • The above instrument is a Hegar’s dilator.
  • It is a metal dilator
  • It is used for mechanical cervical dilatation prior to procedures like dilatation and curettage/ dilatation and evacuation

Other Options

Uterine sound: This is to measure the size and direction of the uterus prior to procedures like an intra-uterine device insertion or a dilatation and curettage

Uterine curette: This instrument is used to curette out (or clear) out the contents of the uterus following a vacuum aspiration

Laminaria Tent: These are hygroscopic cervical dilators which can be used for any procedure requiring cervical dilatation and are even used in indiction of labor. They are not commonly used in India

 

Educational Objective: 

  • This is a Hegars metal dilator and it is used for mechanical cervical dilatation prior to procedures like dilatation and curettage/ dilatation and evacuation

Ref: Page no 360, William’s Obstetrics 25th edition

choices.text: Suspected ectopic pregnancy
HIV/AIDS
Breastfeeding
Multiple pregnancy

questions.text: A 20 year unmarred girl presents to the OPD for a medical termination of pregnancy. Which of the following are contraindications to medical methods of abortion?
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Suspected ectopic pregnancy

Explanation:

Contra-indications to Medical methods of abortion

  1. Anemia (Hb < 8g%)
  2. Confirmed or suspected ectopic pregnancy (** Important)
  3. Uncontrolled HTN
  4. Known case of:
    1. Heart problems such as angina, valvular disease, arrhythmia which can lead to sudden cardiovascular collapse
    2. Renal, liver or respiratory disease (Bronchial asthma is not a contraindication since Misoprostol is a bronchodilator)
    3. Current long-term systemic corticosteroid therapy
    4. Uncontrolled seizure disorder
    5. Chronic adrenal failure
    6. Hypersensitivity to Mifepristone/Misoprostol or other prostaglandins
    7. Inherited porphyria

 

Other options

  • Option B: Medical methods can be safely done if she is HIV +ve
  • Option C: Mifepristone or misoprostol are not c/i in breastfeeding (However, methotrexate is c/i in breastfeeding)
  • Option D:  The standard protocol for medical abortion will not change for multiple pregnancy

Educational Objective: 

 

Contra-indications to Medical methods of abortion

  1. Anemia (Hb < 8g%)
  2. Confirmed or suspected ectopic pregnancy (** Important)
  3. Uncontrolled HTN
  4. Known case of:
    1. Heart problems such as angina, valvular disease, arrhythmia which can lead to sudden cardiovascular collapse
    2. Renal, liver or respiratory disease (Bronchial asthma is not a contraindication since Misoprostol is a bronchodilator)
    3. Current long-term systemic corticosteroid therapy
    4. Uncontrolled seizure disorder
    5. Chronic adrenal failure
    6. Hypersensitivity to Mifepristone/Misoprostol or other prostaglandins
    7. Inherited porphyria

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

choices.text: 5th
7th
10th
15th

questions.text: A 20y woman chooses the medical method of abortion for termination of pregnancy at 7 weeks pregnancy. After giving misoprostol, the woman should be called for follow-up on which day:
questions.solution:
Ans: D. 15th

Explanation:

Procedure for medical MTP as per MOHFW (2016)

On the 15th day (Follow up day), the following is done:

1.  Note relevant history/check medical method of aborton (MMA) follow-up card

2. Carry out pelvic examination to ensure completion of abortion process/continuation of pregnancy

3. Reiterate contraceptive counselling and services

4. Advise USG if

    • complete expulsion of POC not confirmed

    • continuation of pregnancy suspected

    • bleeding continues

5.  Ask the woman to report back if there are no periods within six weeks

Educational Objective: 

Procedure for medical MTP as per MOHFW (2016)

 

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

questions.solution:
Ans: B. 200 mg Mifepristone orally followed 2 days later by 400 mcg Misoprostol sublingual/ buccal/vaginal/oral

choices.text: Vaginal dilators
Hegar’s dilators
Karman’s cannula
Mathew Duncan cervical dilators

questions.text: Identify this instrument:
questions.solution:
Ans: C. Karman’s cannula

Explanation:

  • Karman’s cannula are used alongwith the manual vacuum aspirator or the electrical vacuum aspirator to evacuate the contents of the uterus in a 1st trimester MTP.
  • Size of the cannula (in mm) to be used corresponds to the POG (in weeks); for e.g., for a 6 weeks pregnancy, use Karman’s cannula no 6

Other Options

  • Vaginal dilators: used in vaginismus

  • Hegar dilator: for mechanical cervical dilatation:

  • Matthew Duncan dilator: For mechanical cervical dilatation

 

Educational Objective: 

  • Karman’s cannula are used alongwith the manual vacuum aspirator or the electrical vacuum aspirator to evacuate the contents of the uterus in a 1st trimester MTP.
  • Size of the cannula (in mm) to be used corresponds to the POG (in weeks); for e.g., for a 6 weeks pregnancy, use Karman’s cannula no 6

Ref: Comprehensive Abortion Care: Training and Service Delivery Guidelines 2018 – 2nd edition

choices.text: Methotrexate + misoprostol
Mifepristone + Misoprostol
Only mifepristone
Only misoprostol

questions.text: A woman comes to the OPD with 6 weeks amenorrhea. She has previous 2 cesarean deliveries. She does not want to continue the pregnancy and wants an abortion. Which of the following methods of abortion is most appropriate?
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Mifepristone + Misoprostol 

Explanation

  • The standard regime of medical methods of abortion is to be followed (i.e. mifepristone + misoprostol)
  • Previous cesarean is not a contra-indication to 1st trimester medical abortion

Other Options: 

Option A: Methotrexate + Misorpostol: This is not the preferred regime though is used rarely

Option C: Only mifepristone: Mifepristone alone is not effective for abortion

Option D: Only misoprostol: The success of using misoprostol alone is much less than mifepristone + misoprostol

 

Educational Objective: 

  • The standard regime of medical methods of abortion is to be followed (i.e. mifepristone + misoprostol)
  • Previous cesarean is not a contra-indication to 1st trimester medical abortion

 

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

choices.text: Menstrual regulation syringe
Manual vacuum aspirator
Karman’s cannula
Uterine curette

questions.text: Identify the instrument:
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Manual vacuum aspirator

Explanation

  • This is a manual vacuum aspirator (MVA)
  • It is used in 1st trimester MTP till 12 weeks of gestation
  • It can be easily used in low resource settings for abortions till 12 weeks
  • It consists of 
    • A 60 ml cannula
    • A plunger
    • A double valve apparatus
  • The loaded syringe (this means a syringe wherein vacuum has been created) is attached to the Karman cannula and once instroduced into the dilated cervix, just beyond the internal os, the valves are released and the products of conception get aspirated into the syringe. 

 

Other Options

1. Menstrual regulation syringe: 

  • Menstrual Regulation Syringe refers to the induction of uterine bleeding that has been delayed either to 14 days beyond expected onset or 42 days from the start of the last menstrual period and invovles vacuum aspiration of the uterus with a hand syringe (as shown) and a Karman cannula.

2. Karman's cannula: These are color coded cannula of varying sizes and are attached to the MVA syringe to aspirate contents of the uterus

3. Uterine curette: This is an instrument as shown below, used to curette the endometrium after the products have been evacuated by aspiration. An empty cavity will have a grating sensation when the curette is used. 

 

Educational Objective: 

  • This is a manual vacuum aspirator (MVA)
  • It is used in 1st trimester MTP till 12 weeks of gestation
  • It can be easily used in low resource settings for abortions till 12 weeks
  • It consists of 
    • A 60 ml cannula (PYQ)
    • A plunger
    • A double valve apparatus
  • The loaded syringe (this means a syringe wherein vacuum has been created) is attached to the Karman cannula and once instroduced into the dilated cervix, just beyond the internal os, the valves are released and the products of conception get aspirated into the syringe. 

Ref: Comprehensive Abortion Care: Training and Service Delivery Guidelines 2018 – 2nd edition

choices.text: Less incidence of hemorrhage
Higher success rate
Non invasive
Less incidence of PID

questions.text: A 25-year-old G2P1L1 at 8 weeks pregnancy wants a medical termination of pregnancy for failure of contraception. She wants to know the advantages of medical abortion over surgical methods. All are true except?
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Higher success rate

Explanation:

Advantages of medical abortion:

  1. Lesser incidence of haemorrhage, PID, perforation, long term sequelae like subfertility, cervical insufficiency and Asherman syndrome
  2. Non invasive
  3. No anesthesia required

Disadvantages of medical abortion: 

1. Success rate less than surgical abortion (95-99% with medical abortion; almost 100% with surgical evacuation)

2. Takes about 2 weeks for completion (Surgical procedure is quicker and gets done in a 15-30 minutes. 

 

Other Options: 

  • Option A: Less incidence of hemorrhage is an advantage of medical MTP
  • Option C: Non invasive: is an advantage of medical MTP
  • Option D: Less incidence of PID: Is an advantage of medical MTP

Educational Objective: 

Advantages of medical abortion:

  1. Lesser incidence of haemorrhage, PID, perforation, long term sequelae like subfertility, cervical insufficiency and Asherman syndrome
  2. Non invasive
  3. No anesthesia required

Disadvantages of medical abortion: 

1. Success rate less than surgical abortion (95-99% with medical abortion; almost 100% with surgical evacuation)

2. Takes about 2 weeks for completion (Surgical procedure is quicker and gets done in a 15-30 minutes. 

 

Ref: page no 361; William’s Obstetrics 25th edition

questions.text: A Registered Medical Professional (RMP)is qualified to perform an MTP in first trimester if he has assisted in the following number of MTPs?
questions.solution:
Ans. C. 25

Explanation:

As per the MTP Act (1972) the following are permitted to do an MTP:

A Registered Medical Practitioner provided:

  1. One has assisted in at least 25 MTPs in an authorized center and having a certificate
  2. One has got 6 months training in Obs & Gyn
  3. Diploma or degree in Obs & Gyn

Educational Objective: 

As per the MTP Act (1972) the following are permitted to do an MTP:

A Registered Medical Practitioner provided:

  1. One has assisted in at least 25 MTPs in an authorized center and having a certificate
  2. One has got 6 months training in Obs & Gyn
  3. Diploma or degree in Obs & Gyn

Ref: Page no 164, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics 9th edition

choices.text: Complete the procedure under guidance of the senior obstetrician
Complete the procedure in the OT under laparoscopic guidance
Shift the patient to OT and immediately do a laparotomy and exploration
Observe the patient and complete the procedure after 2 weeks once the perforation has healed

questions.text: While performing a manual vacuum aspiration for a 6 weeks pregnancy, the 1st year gyn resident feels that her instrument is passing through without any resistance. The patient is otherwise hemodynamically stable. She immediately stops the procedure and informs her senior. What should be the next step in the management?
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Complete the procedure in the OT under laparoscopic guidance

Explanation:

Management protocol of uterine perforation:

  • Whenever there is a suspected perforation while doing an D&C or a D&E, the procedure is stopped
    • Observation 
    • Start Antibiotics
    • If procedure is incomplete, diagnostic laparoscopy to assess the perforation and complete the procedure under laparoscopy guidamce
    • Sometimes, in the event of a lateral cervical tear which can enter the uterine arteries or causea a broad ligament hematoma: the patient rapidly goes into shock and a laparotomy + repair/ hysterectomy has to be done
  • In the question given, the best option is to complete the procedure under laparoscopy guidance

Other Options

  • Option 1: A senior obstetrician should be involved but better than his/ her guidance, the procedure should be completed under actual vision
  • Option 3: As the patients vitals are stable, laparotomy is not required
  • Option 4: Waiting for 2 weeks and then completing the procedure is NOT done as this would unecessarily lead to delay with additional complications like bleeding/ infection

Educational Objective: 

  • Whenever there is a suspected perforation while doing an D&C or a D&E, the procedure is stopped
    • Observation 
    • Start Antibiotics
    • If procedure is incomplete, diagnostic laparoscopy to assess the perforation and complete the procedure under laparoscopy guidamce
    • Sometimes, in the event of a lateral cervical tear which can enter the uterine arteries or causea a broad ligament hematoma: the patient rapidly goes into shock and a laparotomy + repair/ hysterectomy has to be done

Ref:  Page no 526, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics 9th edition

choices.text: Absence of air bubbles
Cessation of bleeding
Gripping of cannula
Grating sensation on all walls

questions.text: A 36y G3 undergoes a surgical abortion at 10 weeks pregnancy. All the following signify the completion of procedure following suction evacuation in 1st trimester abortions except?
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Absence of air bubbles

Explanation:

End of procedure in suction evacuation is by the following

    • No more material sucked out
    • Gripping of cannula by the contracting uterus
    • Grating sensation on all uterine walls
    • Air bubbles seen

Educational Objective: 

End of procedure in suction evacuation is by the following

    • No more material sucked out
    • Gripping of cannula by the contracting uterus
    • Grating sensation on all uterine walls
    • Air bubbles seen

 

Ref: Page no 166, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics 9th edition

choices.text: 95 – 99%
90 -94%
85 – 89%
80 – 84%

questions.text: Effectiveness of medical methods of abortion up to 7 weeks is:
questions.solution:
Ans: A. 95-99%

Explanation:

A combination of Mifepristone and Misoprostol has an effectiveness of 95 – 99% for termination of early pregnancy up to seven weeks.

Protocol for Medical method of abortion as per ministry of health and family welfare

* Remember the most preferred route for misoprostol is SUBLINGUAL and the least preferred route is ORAL

Educational Objective: 

  • A combination of Mifepristone and Misoprostol has an effectiveness of 95 – 99% for termination of early pregnancy up to seven weeks.
  • A medical MTP is preferred in 1st trimester abortons < 63 days gestational age (< 9 weeks) but the efficacy is max if done < 7 weeks. 

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

choices.text: Oral pills
Tubectomy
IUCDs
Vasectomy

questions.text: A 34y woman has opted for medical method of MTP at 6 weeks after she had an unplanned pregnancy after failure of contraception. She wants to resume contraception after the medical abortion. Which contraceptive methods can be started on the day of taking Misoprostol?
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Oral pills

Explanation:

  • Combined (estrogen and progestogen) or progestin-only, can be started on the day of the Misoprostol administration (day 3) or day 15 of the medical method of abortion regimen.

Other contraceptive options in relation to medical MTP: 

  •  Injectable hormonal methods like Depot Medroxy Progesterone Acetate (DMPA) can  also be started on day 3 or 15
  • IUCD can be inserted after confirmed complete abortion (and after ruling out infection) on day 15.
  • Condoms can be used as soon as she resumes sexual activity after abortion
  • Tubal ligation can be done after the first menstrual cycle. However, if desirous of concurrent tubal ligation, dilatation and evacuation is preferred
  •  Vasectomy, if chosen, can be done independent of the procedure

Other Options: 

 

  • Option A: Tubal ligation can be done after the first menstrual cycle. However, if desirous of concurrent tubal ligation, dilatation and evacuation is preferred
  • Option B: IUCD can be inserted after confirmed complete abortion (and after ruling out infection) on day 15
  •  Option D: Vasectomy, if chosen, can be done independent of the procedure

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

choices.text: Schedule K
Schedule H
Schedule X
Schedule G

questions.text: Drugs for Medical methods of abortion have been designated by the Drug Controller General of India as:
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Schedule H 

Explanation:

  • Recommended drugs for Medical Methods of  Abortion (MMA) are Mifepristone and Misoprostol.
  • MMA drugs are Schedule H drugs and are to be sold by retail on the prescription of a Registered Medical Practitioner only

Other Options: 

Educational Objective

  • Recommended drugs for Medical Methods of  Abortion (MMA) are Mifepristone and Misoprostol.
  • MMA drugs are Schedule H drugs and are to be sold by retail on the prescription of a Registered Medical Practitioner only

Ref: https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/programmes/maternal-health/guidelines/MMA_Handbook.pdf

choices.text: Anti-estrogen
Anti -progesterone
Selective estrogen receptor modulator
Progesterone

questions.text: Mifepristone is a/ an:
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Anti -progesterone

Explanation:

Mifepristone:

  • Mifepristone is a selective progesterone receptor modulator with more of anti-progesteronic action. 
  • It acts in medical abortions by causing reversal of progesterone induced uterine-quiescence

Educational Objective: 

  • Mifepristone is a selective progesterone receptor modulator (SPRM) with more of anti-progesteronic action. 
  • Other examples os SPRMs used in gynecology is ulipristal acetate which is used as an emergency contraceptive and in medical management of fibroids

 

Ref: page no 361, William’s Obstetrics 25th edition

choices.text: Craniofacial and limb anomalies
Neural tube defects
Congenital heart disease
Cleft lip/ palate

questions.text: Continuation of pregnancy following induced abortion with misoprostol can lead to the following anomalies in the fetus:
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Craniofacial and limb anomalies

Explanation:

Möbius syndrome is:

  • A rare congenital neurological disorder
  • Associated with prenatal exposure to misoprostol and thalidomide
  • Characterized by facial paralysis and the inability to move the eyes from side to side
  • Most people with Möbius syndrome are born with complete facial paralysis and cannot close their eyes or form facial expressions.
  • Limb and chest wall abnormalities sometimes occur with the syndrome.

Educational Objective: 

Möbius syndrome is:

  • A rare congenital neurological disorder
  • Associated with prenatal exposure to misoprostol and thalidomide
  • Characterized by facial paralysis and the inability to move the eyes from side to side
  • Most people with Möbius syndrome are born with complete facial paralysis and cannot close their eyes or form facial expressions.
  • Limb and chest wall abnormalities sometimes occur with the syndrome.

Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%B6bius_syndrome

choices.text: Congenital anomalies
Social reason like rape
Failure of contraception
Unplanned pregnancy

questions.text: All are indications for MTP as per the MTP Act except?
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Unplanned pregnancy

Explanation

Indications for MTP under the MTP Act:

  •  
  • Maternal (therapeutic or medical Indication) – When the risk to the mother is high if she continues the pregnancy.
    • Cardiac disease
    • Chronic kidney ds
    • Malignant HTN
    • Malignancy (E.g., cervical/ breast)
    • Psychiatric illness
    • Uncontrolled epilepsy
  • Eugenic/ Fetal
    • Congenital anomalies
    • Chromosomal anomalies
    • Infections like rubella
  • Social
  • Failure of contraception

 

Educational Objective: 

4 main indications of MTP under the MTP Act < 20 weeks are: 

  • Maternal (therapeutic or medical Indication) – When the risk to the mother is high if she continues the pregnancy.
  • Eugenic/ Fetal: Fetal or chromosomal anomaly or fetal infection
  • Social (pregnancy due to rape)
  • Failure of contraception

 

Ref: Page no 164, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics 9th edition

choices.text: Mifepristone + Misoprostol
Vacuum aspiration
Extra-amniotic instillation of ethacridine
Concentrated oxytocin

questions.text: The preferred method for an induced abortion at 10 weeks is:
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Vacuum aspiration

Explanation

Other Options: 

  • Option A: Mifepritone + Misoprostol is preferred till 9 weeks but efficacy reduces after 7 weeks
  • Option C: Extra amniotic instillation of ethacridine lactate: This is done very rarely now in 2nd trimester abortions
  • Option D: Concentrated oxytocin: This is a rare approach, sometimes tried for 2nd trimester abortions

Educational Objective: 

Ref: Page no 164, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics 9th edition
